issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: In the current trunk/0.23 codebase there are 5 findbugs warnings which cause the precommit CI builds to -1 the patches.
fields.summary: Fix findbugs warnings in Map Reduce.

comments.body:
There are 13 errors now. Bugs are escaping because of Jenkins' broken links, we are close to fixing that.

I am going to fix the warnings for the time being.
The warnings are increasing day over day and commit over commit. Attaching patch that should fix the findBugs warnings.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12493283/MAPREDUCE-2908-20110907.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 15 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce -9 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:

                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestNMAuditLogger

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/620//testReport/

bq. -1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
bq. org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestNMAuditLogger
This is due to MAPREDUCE-2942.

All the findBugs warnings are reported to have been fixed by this patch. It is ready for review/commit.
This looks like a step forward to me. +1. What was the motivation behind renaming Queue to AbstractQueue in the capacity scheduler?

bq. What was the motivation behind renaming Queue to AbstractQueue in the capacity scheduler?
Yeah, that was the only big change, I should've commented about it before itself. This was to address a findBugs warning which complained that _o.a.h.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.capacity.Queue_ implements the top level _o.a.h.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.Queue_ and shares the same name but different packages. I myself did find it to be confusing, so renamed it instead of excluding it from the warning list.
Maybe we should call it CSQueue rather than AbstractQueue?
